results.title: Defeat diphtheria. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Paul Rotha, Paul Rotha Productions and Bladon Peake
results.brief_description: An effective plea for more general recognition of the benefits of immunization against diphtheria. although diphtheria is the particular example given special stress, the film mentions also the importance of observing other methods of preventing the spread of contagious and epidemic diseases.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Rotha, Paul Rotha Productions and Bladon Peake

results.title: Deeth treo
results.brief_description: A surreal cut-out animation of a lone horse seen travelling the desert with a mortally wounded knight strapped to his back. The horse in collusion with the tree delivers the corpse to sate the tree’s canabalistic desires. A black comedy.

results.title: Deer in the works
results.brief_description: Adapted from the short story “Deer in the works” by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr, written in 1955. This film is about David Potter (Dennis Dugan) who was admitted to Ilium Works employment office hoping to land a writing job. Running his own small newspaper was too insecure now that the twin girls were born. After a preliminary interview and physical, he was hired and sent through the deafening noise and ceaseless activity of the huge, maze-like industrial complex to Lou Flammer in publicity. A story was already waiting for him: a deer was loose in the Works. But the confusion of endless buildings and labs, the faceless people and the elusiveness of the deer made David’s search for the story fruitless - until he saw a mob armed with sticks and shovels chasing the small, frightened deer. His course of action was clear: David opened the gate leading to the nearby wood. The deer bolted out…and David Potter followed. he didn’t look back. Includes themes of alienation and anonymity in modern society.

results.title: Deep threat = Mer mere
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and Don Arioli
results.brief_description: Humour helps bring home a serious point in this animated, wordless film. The sea has its own laws and man is accountable to them. Man is shown evolving from the sea, then developing industry and the wastes that pollute that same sea. (Awards: Toulon, San Antonio)

results.title: Deep shit
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Morgan Evans
results.brief_description: When Mr Sideburns (Morgan Evans) stumbles across a security camera tape from the casino which incriminates the Premier, he finds a variety of sources are eager to lay hands on the material. With a casual nod to the Hong Kong action genre, Deep Shit’s momentum carries the viewer through such recognisable Melbourne locales as Parliament Station, Melbourne Central and Queen Victoria Market.

results.title: Deep sea trawler
results.brief_description: Part of the “Man and his world” series, this film describes a trawler’s voyage from its home port on the North Sea to the Grand Banks off Newfoundland. Shows the complete operation of catching and processing the fish.
